dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - the high-end, high-tech, luxury Lexus LX SUV.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Ride it up to $200,000, $220 cap... no more than 10% down, 7.5% makes me sing. And get the Miguels ready. It's 2 grand a month on interest alone. I want to flip this finger. Get back to me. - Call office. On-Board system DIALS. The two Sheriffs knock on his wind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else, boss?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Next eviction’s Tuesday. Natalia’ll call you. They leave. He scrolls emails on an iPad secured to his d

dialogues.speaker: NATALIA, (THROUGH SPEAKERS)
dialogues.text: Rick Carver Realty.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Talk to me. My world’s upside-down.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIA, (THROUGH SPEAKERS)
dialogues.text: I’m emailing your revised itinerary... Also, um, Jerry from Toyota Credit called again -

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: - Jerry's full of shit. Keep talking.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIA, (THROUGH SPEAKERS)
dialogues.text: The high rise came through, PUDs and all. What do you want me to tell them? Suddenly hears SHRIEKING. He looks out the window: Police hold back the SHRIEKING Wife as EMTs push her Dead Husband on a gurney and load him into a waiting ambulance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DENNIS NASH (29, blue collar, smart) and DENNIS’ CREW (2 Guys) put up a mansion. Dennis chalks lines based on blueprints. Uses a power saw cut wood. Hot, he’s sweating; tats on his arms. Dennis puts up the frame. Walking on wood beams way up hi

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: ELLIOTT, the GC (30s-50s) argues with Crew Leader who sto Dennis and Crew.

dialogues.speaker: CREW LEADER
dialogues.text: Stop working! That’s it. Stop! The buyer doesn’t qualify, the lender’s out, we’re done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean in terms of payment?

dialogues.speaker: CREW LEADER
dialogues.text: It means we’ve been working for free. All this from roof to cement is for nothing. Hey, no more dinero! Stop! Let’s go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONNOR (9, smart, inquisitive, stubborn) and FRANK’S SON look at Australia on a large globe. FRANK GREENE (30s-40s, blue collar, smart, humble) FRANK' WIFE and FRANK'S SON #2 (5) nearby. Dennis is on the phon

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Connor. What’re you doing? We're gonna be late. Come on. Connor shrugs and says goodbye to Frank’s son.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Who’s that?

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: We're in the same school. A paper falls from Dennis’ folder. Connor picks it up and hands it to his dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bailiff tries to keep order in the chaotic courtroom confused HOMEOWNERS and gossiping LAWYERS. Connor watches Dennis defending himself against the FREEM LAWYER. A JUDGE (50s-70s) presides.

dialogues.speaker: FREEMAN LAWYER
dialogues.text: Your Honor, he missed three payments and is underwater over $80 grand. The bank could have a buyer in place within 30 days.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Did you fail to make three payments, Mr. Nash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir - but I was told to, it was two departments of the same bank telling me the opposite thing and then just recently I got this final notice for eviction -

dialogues.speaker: FREEMAN LAWYER
dialogues.text: Your Honor, you already entered summary judgement here. We’d like to close by the end of the month.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: I see no reason to hold up the sale

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Hold on a minute - they told me not to pay, that’s why I’m behind, they told me - it was two departments of the same bank, telling me different things your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: While I’m sympathetic to your situation, I have 40,000 cases like this backed up behind yours. Final judgement granted. I’m ordered you to vacate the premises.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: That's my family home, your Honor. I was born and raised in that home. So was my son, Connor. Please don’t do this. We’ve lived there our whole lives, my mom runs her business out of that home. That’s our second source of income.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: This is your son?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Yes, that’s my son.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Then he should be in school, not here.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: He’s gonna lose his school with all due respect your Honor, if we lose our home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun Trust versus Cunningham.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Give me a bit more time your honor.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Bailiff, please remove Mr. Nash.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Your honor, I just need a bit more time. Excuse me, I just need a bit more time.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: You have 30 days to file an appeal like everyone else. Bailiff please remove Mr. Nash. Connor watches the Bailiff move Dennis aside as the next HOMEOWNER awkwardly takes Dennis’ place. INT. DENNIS’ TRUCK [MOVING] - DAY Dennis smokes and drives; Connor near him. They've lost.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Where’re we going to stay if we lose the home?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: We’re not losing the home, bud.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: How do you know? The cops aren’t coming back? I just wanna know how you’re gonna pay for it.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Connor! - I’m gonna figure it out. That judge gave us 30 days. No one’s taking the home from us. EXT. DENNIS’ HOME / NEIGHBORHOOD - DAY Dennis’ middle-class home. DEREK and KIDS ride bikes and in the street. Dennis pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Yo, Derek!  7. He runs off to play with Derek. Dennis checks the mail; w to a NEIGHBOR. Connor rides bikes.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: You be careful, Connor! INT. DENNIS’ HOME - CONTINUOUS His mom, LYNN cuts her CLIENT’s hair. Lynn is a hairdress who loves her family; she’s social, moody, loving, a litt lost since her husband died.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: So, tell me everything - did they give you a lawyer, did they - ?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: It's the same story with the bank guys, it’s the same story everywhere we go.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: (to her client) We have to find a lawyer, you know - He goes to the living room and shuffles through piles of bills, notes, bank paperwork. (Their home is cluttered, lived-in; the decor belongs to parents. Family photos line the wall, including Dennis’ d The family has lived here over 40 years. It feels like it

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I’m just trying to figure out what this 30-day thing means; he said we've got 30 days to file an appeal, but does that mean the eviction’s not happening tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: But the judge told you 30 days.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I know, the judge said we got 30 days to file for an appeal -

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Well he’s a judge, not a bartender! We’re in good shape.  INT. DENNIS’ HOME / KITCHEN & LIVING ROOM - NIGHT In the living room: Dennis sits at a table with a mountai bills and an eviction notice. Quick series of phone call:

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: My name is Dennis Nash, I’m calling looking for representation. I understand that you guys sometimes do not need a retainer?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: When you went through what you went through, you were able to find someone pro bono - I’m just wondering if he can help? LATER: In the kitchen, Lynn brings dinner to Connor who studies. A loving bond between them.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Lost is to found as outside is to indoors, inside -

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: And what’s another example?

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Black and white?

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: (gives him a plate) Black and white? What’s another one? Give me one more. LATER: In the living room, Dennis looks exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: 454-0189. Please give us a call back. Dennis puts down the phone, exhausted, losing hope - but stretches and reenergizes himself for more calls. EXT. DENNIS’ HOME - NIGHT Lynn smokes. Dennis enters. They share a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Sometimes, I don’t know what to say to Connor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was so young when I had you, you had to raise me.... you’1ll know what to say. INT. DENNIS’ HOME; CONNOR’S ROOM - NIGHT Connor lies asleep in bed. Dennis watches him from the hallway. He turns off the light. EXT. DENNIS’ HOME - MORNING MEN gather on the lawn: Sheriffs (from opening scene), a LOCKSMITH, JEFF (redneck) and his CLEAN-OUT-CREW (4 low-c guys) near a van and truck. Rick Carver pulls up. INT./EXT. RICK’S RANGE ROVER / DENNIS’ HOME - CONTINUOUS Rick speaks into “on board;" he props his foot up - AN AN HOLSTER WITH A GUN. Checks his Ruger, puts it back.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Borrow against Blair Street to cover Via Alizar. I'll flip that this quarter.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIA, (THROUGH SPEAKERS)
dialogues.text: Good. And Landon at code enforcement?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: I have a short sale for that cocksucker. I’1l email the details.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIA, (THROUGH SPEAKERS)
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Afternoon, boss. Love the new ride.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Range Rover HSE.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Is this the Nash eviction?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Yeah, anyone home?  10.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: I’m not sure, but their vehicle’s home.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Alright, let’s get to it. They approach Dennis’ door. Sherriff #1 knocks. Dennis looks out the window. They see him.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: He’s at the window. Rick looks over. He and Dennis lock eyes for the first ti INT. DENNIS’ HOME - CONTINUOUS Dennis hesitates, Sheriff knocking. Doesn’t know what to He looks in the next room, sees Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Sheriffs are here.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Why are they here? Knocking LOUDER. They go to the door. Dennis opens the front door as the two large Sheriffs ste forward. Lynn stands next to Dennis.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Good afternoon. I’m Deputy Anderson with the Sheriffs department and we’re here to serve you a court-— ordered eviction.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: No. I think there’s a mistake. We have -

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Sir, ma'am, do either of you have weapons on your body or in the property?

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: No no no, not us.  11.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Mr. Carver! Dennis watches Rick come forward.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Good morning, sir. Ma’am. I’m Rick Carver, a real estate broker, and I’m sorry to say this home has been foreclosed on and officially transferred to the bank. I’1l need you to please vacate the property.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Nobody's “vacating” the home. I was in court yesterday, and the Judge informed me I have thirty days to file an appeal and that’s what I’m going to do.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Please show me you’ve posted bond and have an emergency stay signed by a judge, and you're welcome to remain here.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I got a question, you guys didn’t get any rescheduling of the -

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: (shows paper) This is a court order signed by a judge dated today for you to leave this property.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Rick?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Mom.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: My office offered you a $3,500 cash- for-keys settlement from the bank to leave last month, but you refused.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Yes, we refused.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Well, we didn’t refuse, we tried to save our house -  12.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: I appreciate this is a difficult situation, but the time has come, you have to leave the property. You are trespassing right now, you are breaking the law.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Sir, this is our home, so, we just need a few minutes - Rick motions to Sheriff #1, who steps forward. Rick walks away and puts his sunglasses on.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Sir, you and your mom need to step foot out of the home now.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: No. We’re not going to do that. Just give us 24 hours -

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: You all can come back, same time, and if we don’t have the papers, we don't have the proof, then we will leave.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: We have a lawyer, we have it all figured out. Lynn tries to close the door.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: We need a day.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Ma’am, do NOT close the door.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: We need a day.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Here’s what I can do. You have two minutes to gather whatever personal items you need - cash, checkbooks, medicines - and then -

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: No, this isn’t happening.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Yes, this is happening.  13.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: No, this isn’t happening.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: I’m going to call the lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Ma’am! Excuse me. Sheriff #2 moves past Dennis, entering the home.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Excuse me, please don’t come into my house.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: There are two ways that we can do this. The easy way, where you do what you’re told. Or the hard way, where I take you and your mom to jail. Do you want your mom to go to jail? What I’d like you to do, take advantage of the two minutes - Dennis notices Rick standing inside his house.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Sir, would you mind stepping outside of the property?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: This isn’t your home, son.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Mr. Carver? Rick ignores him and walks into the house. The Sheriff li off statues of the law.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Sir, we have the right to an attorney. Just because somebody forgot to call you, we don’t geta lawyer?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: It's better not to get emotional right now ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: You’re kicking us out of our home!

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: PLEASE, okay, please!  14.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Enough of this, let’s go. Dennis calms his screaming mom and relents. They start packing up.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Get what you need to get and let’s go. LYNN’S BEDROOM Sheriff #2 watches Lynn grab her jewelry, checkbook, medicines.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Sir, I don’t need your help, ok? Do you need to follow a woman into her bedroom?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: It's just department policy. Money, checkbooks, things like that. Wallets, pictures -

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: I’m trying to get pictures!

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Sheriff #1 hovers over Dennis as he grabs Connor’s books, things, an Orlando Magic basketball jersey...

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Does he have to stand there with her as she packs up her underwear?! Is that right?!

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: It's policy, sir. Dennis takes down Connor’s basketball hoop. He notices Ri standing in the hallway. Rick walks on.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Dennis carries out a box of belongings. Lynn emerges with box of her own.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: What else mom? They frantically look around.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: I want my plants.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: There’s no time for that. You need to step outside now.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Let her take the plant.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Your two minutes are long gone, you need to move.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Can I ask where it says two minutes on your clipboard?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Sir, the two minutes is a courtesy.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: The two minutes is what?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: A courtesy. You’re trespassing right now. I know it’s painful to hear but it’s the truth.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Ma’am, do you need anything else?

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Yes, the toaster oven. My grandson likes his toast in the mornings. Rick unplugs the toaster and hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Alright, Randy, you said the two minutes was up, right? Dennis moves into the living room for the bills on the ta

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I’m just getting the bills.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Ok. This way, this way.  16. He escorts Dennis and Lynn out. EXT. DENNIS’ HOME - CONTINUOUS Out of them home where Rick motions to the Locksmith and BZ2Z222Z - startles Dennis. He’s already changing the loc

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: (to Rick) I’m gonna clear it. He goes back in as Rick escorts Dennis and Lynn to the cu

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: All the way to the curb. You’re now trespassing on a bank-owned home - you can’t stand in the lawn. All the way to the curb, please.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: We're going.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: What about the rest of our things?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: The clean-out-crew will bring your belongings to the end of the drive. No need to worry about that. They reach the curb; Dennis puts the large plant down.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: My advice would be to get a moving truck because your neighbors are going to have access to everything you own by the end of the day. Lynn turns to Dennis, who avoids her look. Rick notices. Sheriff #1 steps out of the home:

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Jeff, get ‘em to it! He motions to Jeff who leads his crew into the home. Rick follows them. NEIGHBORS stare at Dennis and Lynn from their lawns.  17. Crew exits with sofa, coffee table, TV, and dump them in front of Dennis and Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: (to neighbors) Can you believe this? They canceled the eviction and didn’t even tell these guys. She is shamed in front of her neighbors. Crew continue to bring out furniture. Lynn is shaking.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Oh my god, oh my god... Dennis stares, watching his house get emptied by stranger Rick stares at Dennis from the porch smoking his e-cigare EXT. DENNIS’ HOME - LATER The piles of belongings on the street and in Dennis’ truc have grown larger. The Crew continues to work. Dennis gathers things; Neighbor Friend and HUSBAND stand Lynn, who sits in the chair trying to keep her dignity. Dennis notices Jeff trying to move his red tool cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Hey! Yo! Don’t mess with that, man. You gotta unlock the wheels, and don’t touch anything inside there. Jeff ignores him. Dennis mumbles curses and lifts a heavy overturned chest. He SLAMS scattered drawers into place.

dialogues.speaker: NEIGHBOR FRIEND
dialogues.text: Wanna put some stuff in our garage? We don’t have much room, but...

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Some of the valuables. Thanks. He turns to see: the school bus pull up. Connor, Derek an some kids get off the bus. Dennis is uncertain what to do. Connor takes in what is happening. The SCHOOL KIDS gossip and giggle as the bus drives away.  18.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Yo, what’s happening?... Suddenly, Connor walks towards the house.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Connor, wait - Rick gets in his way.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Hey, son. Where you headed?

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: This is my house.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, this isn’t your home anymore.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: That’s my house.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: (to Rick) Please don’t talk to my son. Talk to me. (grabs Connor’s arm) Let's go. Connor rips his arm free. Dennis grabs him again. They struggle as Dennis tries to hold onto him.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Get off! I want to go to my room.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Mr. Nash, I know this is difficult, but please take your son off the property.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: That’s my house. I want to go to my room.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I know. We’ll go to your room later.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Mr. Nash, please.  19.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I heard you! - Connor, stop. Rick motions to the Sheriffs who approach while Dennis tr to control Connor. The Neighbors stare.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Let go of me! Let go! That’s our house! Dennis stares at his son... total loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. DENNIS’ HOME - LATER The pile of belongings is even larger. The eviction is ov Connor and Derek across the street.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Where you moving to?

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: I dunno.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Are you coming to school tomorrow? Connor shrugs; Dennis calls him over; Connor walks when -

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Can we still play NBA 2K tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: See ya... Dennis puts his mom into the truck next to Connor. Dennis his Neighbor friend exchange looks and a hand shake. Rick approaches Dennis as he gets in his truck.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Mr. Nash, you have 24 hours before my crew will return and dispose of whatever remains. Not my choice; Code enforcement. Good luck. Dennis gets in his truck. Lynn and her friend clasp hands the truck pulls away leaving their home behind.  20. I/E. DENNIS’ PICK-UP TRUCK [MOVING] / ORLANDO - SUNSET Like Okies from the Dust Bowl, the family is crammed in t crowded truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis’ truck pulls in and parks. As they unpack they see MOTEL RESIDENTS, THUGS, POOR FAMILIES hang out, drink nea the pool, etc. Balconies piled with belongings, clothes h to dry. They realize families live here. MOTEL WOMAN (40s) hangs with a couple friends at their do talking.

dialogues.speaker: MOTEL WOMAN
dialogues.text: Hey. Welcome. What room ya'll in?

dialogues.speaker: MOTEL WOMAN
dialogues.text: It’s over there. We can watch your stuff while you move... How long you staying?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Just a couple nights.

dialogues.speaker: MOTEL WOMAN
dialogues.text: Two years ago that’s what we said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They carry boxes up stairs and along the hallway where JU (13) and other kids get sodas from a machine and hang out They enter -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connor runs to the bathroom and pees. Dennis and Lynn loo over the tiny room: two beds, small kitchenette, dripping faucet. How are they going to live here? Dennis sets Lynn’s tall plant down.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: It smells. Do you think someone died in here?  21.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Don’t say things like that. Get that side, we can’t sleep in these. They pull comforters off the beds. As Dennis exits - He presses on her shoulder reassuring her.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I‘ll get the rest of our stuff. He exits -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - and pauses to light a cigarette; he hears Connor and tu to watch his family through the window:

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Am I going to school tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Gotta figure all that out, don’t we?

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: I gotta see Derek. We’re in the middle of an NBA 2K tournament and - Dennis looks at his family through the window. HOLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis pumps gas - 5, 20, 30 dollars. It’s fucking expens

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: I’m calling about the roofing job... I got a ton of experience, I do electric, plumbing, construction, anything... Okay. Any lower level stuff? He looks at little speakers BLARING bad pop music near a screen TV flashing ads about hot dogs and soda. INT. DENNIS’ TRUCK [MOVING] - DAY Dennis drives.  22.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: What about Booth brothers? They were putting up those home on - ... Call me if something comes up. INT./EXT. DENNIS’ TRUCK / NEW SUBDIVISION - SUNSET Dennis looks at an OUT OF BUSINESS sign on the constructi trailer. He drives away lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Party MUSIC and sounds penetrate the Nash’s tiny room, bursting with their stuff. Lynn sleeps in one bed. Dennis Connor share the other. Dennis is awake staring at his son, tousling his hair.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Dennis, this motel is half-full of people like us.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: They’re not people like us.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: They're all evicted. And they get stuck here. I could maybe take the bus and start looking for apartments...

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: We can’t afford an apartment.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: It’s just first and last month’s rent!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Two or three months’ security. Four maybe, because of our credit. Our credit is shot.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Dennis... We’ve got to get out of here. We should go to Tampa. We’ve gotta go to Uncle Jimmy’s, Uncle Jimmy said we could come. I talked to Mary Margaret just three days ago!  23.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Mom, we're not moving to Tampa. You wanna take Connor out of school? Take him away from his friends? We leave, we give up, we let the house go. He tries to give his mom confidence:

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I’m gonna figure it out. Lynn is unsure. But Dennis is resolute.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: No choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connor’s playing on his phone.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: You want some toast? Dennis rifles through the tool cabinet they’ve brought up the room. He notices something missing.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: We didn’t leave any tools in my truck, right?

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: No, we got everything. Angry, Dennis slams the drawer shuts. Thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and his clean-out-crew plus four other CREW GUYS hav coffee and donuts near their vans and trucks (MUSIC playi outside RICHARD CARVER REALTY. BILL (30s, big and tall) g them orders; Dennis pulls up and strides to them.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Your guys stole my tools yesterday. I want to talk to your boss.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I’m senior sales manager. What’s the problem?  24.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: (points at Jeff) That guy right there stole my impact wrench and in-line sander. That’s like $500.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I have a form you can -

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: No forms. - Hey man, give me my tools back.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I didn't steal nothing. Get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Where’s my stuff?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I didn't steal nothing. Get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: You just said that, dumbass. Crew laugh. Jeff shoves Dennis. They wrestle in the parki lot. Crew gather and holler. Rick exits the second story and sees what’s happening.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Break it up! God damn it, Jeff, that’s enough. Rick strides down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on?! He motions and they immediately pull Dennis and Jeff apar It takes three Crew guys to hold Dennis back. Jeff tries sucker punch him, but Dennis kicks Jeff in the stomach.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Bill, you want to get in on this? Take a couple swings?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Sir, I -  25.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: “Sir, I -" “Sir, I -". What the fuck are you still doing here anyway?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I thought, sir - I thought you -

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: You thought? You're evolving? Has Darwin himself come to Orlando, Florida?... Well? Bill?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: We'll be there on time, Mr. Carver. Guys, let’s go! Buena Vista Lakes. He rounds up half the guys and drives away. Rick walks up Dennis and motions and they release him.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: You finished? ‘Cause I got the cops on speed dial. they’1l run you out of town over a busted tail light.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I’m not here to fight; I just want my tools.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Do I look like Ace Hardware? I don’t deal in tools, I deal in homes. There’s a difference.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I know. You took my home from me.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: No, the bank took your home from you. I just represent it. He answers his phone. Dennis lights a cigarette; listens.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: This is Rick Carver... What?... You gotta be kidding me. God damn it... When?... Fuck Hazmat, I’1l call ‘em myself. (hangs up; to Jeff) 914 Shader Drive. Now.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I thought we had to prep Via Alizar-  26. CLAP CLAP.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Move! Move! Jeff rounds up crew. Dennis follows Rick to his Range Rov

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Rick Carver Realty?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Can you Miguel?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Can you work? You have tools. Do you do construction?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: I pay $50, cash.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: $50 shouldn’t be a joke to you. He speeds away. Dennis mumbles curses, gets in his truck INT. DENNIS’ TRUCK - CONTINUOUS - SLAMS the door. Dennis jerks the wheel and speeds throu the light following Rick. INT./EXT. DENNIS’ TRUCK / SEWAGE HOME - MORNING Dennis pulls up to a foreclosed home. He sees: Rick, Jeff and the Crew are taken aback to see a foreclos home with nasty black raw sewage creeping out the door. Rick covers his mouth with a handkerchief and gets his ph Jeff and the Crew cover their noses and shove each other kids towards the sewage. Dennis gets out and keeps his distance.  27.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: I need your Hazmat team here NOW or I’m looking at a total gut job down to the God damn studs... Eviction was next week and these animals backed up the sewage and skipped town... What do you mean shit’s not a hazardous material. Why don’t you come out here and eat some of it, maybe that would change your mind. Rick notices Dennis. Jeff and Crew are surprised to see h Jeff steps towards Dennis but Rick WHISTLES for him to st

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: The neighbors are threatening to call the Department of Health, so if your team isn’t out here in 30 minutes, my next call is gonna be Fannie about your slow-ass response time... Fuck you, too! (hangs up) God damn it. He turns to Jeff and the crew.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Rick, no. - Mr. Carver! That’s a hazard. We, we can’t...

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: By tonight, the mold’s up to the ceiling; by tomorrow, someone's paying MONEY to demolish it, and it’s not going to be me. Dennis notices Jeff and the others sheepishly back away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is surprised. Rick and Dennis lock eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: 200. That’s a bear and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: -.. Deal.  28. Dennis grabs a shovel, walks past Jeff and towards the encroaching sludge and enters into -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stench SLAPS him Spray-painted in His boots squish sewage cascading He gags and runs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in the face. Eyes water, holds his breath. red on the wall Dennis reads: KILL BANKERS in the sludge. He covers his nose and sees from the toilet and sinks. out. — CONTINUOUS Dennis staggers out and vomits in the yard. Jeff and Crew laugh. Rick remains straight-faced.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Harden the fuck up, son!

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: (to Jeff) There better be a container truck, shop vacs and giant blowers here in one hour or I’1l make it my business that you never work in Orange County again. You will also finish Via Alizar today. You’re on my list, shit fuck. He approaches Dennis with a cold water bottle. Dennis drinks, spits, drinks.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: What else can you do? Framing, plumbing, electric, roofing?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: All of them. Anything. Go on. Dennis head back

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Finish it. toward the door. Then looks to the Crew.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Six-pack to the first guy in here with a shovel... Come on!  29. Curious, Rick watches the Crew... one of them steps up.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: $100. And Mr. Nash’s six-pack. Crew accepts. He puts on a dust mask.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Let’s go! Who else? You! Come on, I know you need the money. The Men laugh and two more join. Only Jeff remains outsid

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Alright, let’s get this shit done. He wraps his shirt around his nose and mouth - like a ban The others do the same and Dennis leads the men to work. Rick is impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connor looks up from homework as Dennis steps in. Dennis into his dirty jeans and hands Lynn money. Connor looks up, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I got work. And there’s more tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: With who? What work? Dennis!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Some new guy. Real estate. You don’t know him. They laugh, overjoyed. Connor tries to take the money. De play-wrestles it back from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis walks fast, Connor drags his feet.  30.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: You’re gonna make new friends, ok?

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: I don’t want to. They reach Motel Kids and a handful of PARENTS and see a school bus arrive. Kids board; Connor doesn’t move.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I know. But I need you to be brave. He tries to rub Connor’s ear but Connor brushes him off.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: This isn’t my school.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I know, but you gotta keep your grades up, remember? You gotta take care of yourself, ok? I love you. Connor runs to the bus. Dennis watches the bus drive away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Massive, very impressive and unique, Rick’s home sits at end of a deep and beautifully landscaped lawn. Dennis pulls up; he’s impressed. Grabs his tool box and w to the front door when his phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Mr. Carver, I’m -

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER, (THROUGH PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yeah, I see you. Come around back.

dialogues.speaker: RICK'S POOL WITH LANAI
dialogues.text: Dennis enters and sees Rick's DAUGHTERS (6 to 12) playing the pool.

dialogues.speaker: RICK'S DAUGHTER
dialogues.text: Hey. Can you get us that please? Dennis uses a pool net to try and push a boat from the ce of the pool to Rick's Daughters on the other side. Rick walks up steps leading from his dock near the lake.  31.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Nash. Princess one, princess two, princess three! Who wants Haagen- Dazs? Chocolate chip cookie dough.

dialogues.speaker: RICK'S DAUGHTERS
dialogues.text: Me, me, me! Dennis follows Rick and his girls into -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - a very impressive living room / kitchen where a MAID wo

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Nice house.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: It's ok. I got it 18 months ago and I’m going to flip it after New Year's. (to the maid) Let’s have some Haagen-Daaz please, madam. (to Dennis) AC’s out for two hours. Through there. You’ll see the leak. Dennis exits as Rick crushes cookies into the ice cream.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: I’m gonna make it even better. See.

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Dennis walks through the grand entrance, high ceilings, t of sunlight. Continues to -

dialogues.speaker: RICK'S HOME OFFICE
dialogues.text: A second living room and sees the water stain on the ceil But his attention is focused to maps of Orange County tha cover the walls and are laid out everywhere. It’s impress Dennis zeros in on framed articles about Rick Carver, Rea Estate tycoon and good citizen of Orlando. Dennis takes it all in.

dialogues.speaker: RICK'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Rick grabs a bag and some shirts when his phone RINGS.  32.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: This is Rick Carver. MALE’S VOICE (THROUGH PHONE) Adjustable mortgage cocksucker! I’m homeless, you motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Stop calling me! You defaulted on - MALE’S VOICE (THROUGH PHONE) Fuck you, Carver. You piece of - Rick hangs up, tense. He notices his Wife smoking on the terrace outside. She’s been watching him.

dialogues.speaker: TERRACE
dialogues.text: Rick steps out and joins her. RICK’S WIFE They called here two days ago.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Come on boo, I rented you and your mom a week at the Corazon Spa in the Keys. I want you to relax, enjoy yourselves.

dialogues.speaker: RICK'S WIFE
dialogues.text: I should divorce you.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: We'd lose on taxes; and you’d miss me. You'd miss your little Ricky. They kiss and make out.

dialogues.speaker: RICK'S ATTIC
dialogues.text: Dennis uses a small blow dryer to thaw out frozen coils o the condensing unit. EXT RICK’S HOME With the hose of a small shop vac, Dennis sucks green mol from the PVC on the side of Rick's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis drinks a beer near the pool as he stares at Rick's boat, the lake, the life. RICH PEOPLE ride past in a boat wave at Rick who approaches.  33.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: What’re you doing?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Finished. Give the coils 5 minutes to drain and you’ll have cold air.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: It’s not even been an hour.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I salvaged your ceiling with mud and found some spare paint in your garage, so your ceiling’s good to go too. Rick is impressed.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Unless you’re planning on taking a swim, let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the moving window: homes. Rick glances at Dennis.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: What do you see out there?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Homes.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: I just saw nine opportunities to make money in the last five blocks. We passed three homes without mail boxes, one with an overgrown lawn and no cars in the drive, two with white signs taped in the window and three with shiny new doorknobs and lock-boxes. If you can get attuned to seeing these opportunities, then Maybe you can get off your hands and knees and really start working for me.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I can work. You seen me all week.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: I heard you worked on good crews with Rick Kirby and Chris Camilleri. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They’re both out of business, because they built homes. I own homes. Dennis considers Rick.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: You know what I am, I am a man with a helluva lot of properties. You can be a part of that. What I want to know is that I can walk away from any situation, 24/7, and have someone to handle it. I don’t care if your kid’s in the school play, it’s Christmas, or you lined up the best blow job in Orlando. When you work for me, you’re mine. Suddenly Rick hits the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: What the hell? I/E. RICK'S RANGE ROVER / FRANK GREENE’S STREET - CONTINU Rick goes in reverse. Stops. Looks at two homes, one with “Rick Carver Realty” sign in the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Call office. (DIALING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that? Those cables?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, I see it. Rick points to an extension cord and water hose running f one house to another. I/E. RICK'S RANGE ROVER / FRANK GREENE’S HOME - CONTINUOU He reverses and parks in front of Frank’s house.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIA, (THROUGH SPEAKERS)
dialogues.text: Rick Carver Realty.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: I got some jack wagon at 354 Ridgeway stealing water and power from our property at 352 Ridgeway. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pull up the county court website, get his name and find out if he’s in default. I’m in front of his house now.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIA, (THROUGH SPEAKERS)
dialogues.text: Right away, sir. Rick hangs up, opens the glove compartment and produces a - an LCP 308. He hands Dennis the gun.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: You know how to shoot, right? We'll run a background check so you can carry a concealed weapon.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Are you fucking with me?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Angry homeowners. You’1ll need it. Rick checks his Ruger on his ankle holster.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Naw. I’m good. Dennis puts the gun back in the glove compartment.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. But the person on the other side of the door doesn’t always feel that way. Trust me. He shows the marks of a dog bite on his skin.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: They can feed their Rottweiler, but they can’t pay for their house. Dennis considers. Rick’s phone beeps.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Ok. Frank Greene. Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick KNOCKS loudly. Dennis walks up next to him. Frank Gr (same man from court) opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Mr. Frank Greene?  36.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: My name is Rick Carver and you’re stealing from me.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: -.. If you’re referring to the -

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: - The property next door belongs to Fannie Mae and I represent it for them. So you're not only stealing from me, you're stealing from the United States government. He answers his RINGING PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m with Frank Greene now. What’ve you got for me? (to Dennis) Remove those lines. He steps aside, leaving Dennis alone with Frank Greene. They walk to the side of the house and begin to disconnec and coil up the cable and hose.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: I saw you in foreclosure court. Our sons go to the same school. They were playing with the globe. I had my show cause hearing that day. What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I lost... I was evicted.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: ++. So what’re you doing with him?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Gotta work, you know? He offered me a job. This isn’t really what I do.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: (regarding cables) Yeah, this isn’t really what I do either... I was a manager at Custom Cabinet and Lighting. Been out of work for two years. Two. But I’m not a thief.  37.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: But I’m researching on the internet and public library. I’m gonna save my home.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I hope you do. Custom Cabinets - yeah, I installed your stuff.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: Oh really?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, a bunch of times. Frank’s Son (from court) approaches.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK'S SON
dialogues.text: Dad, the TV turned off.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: You know my boy? Connor Nash?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK'S SON
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Rick comes back.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Mr. Greene, looks like the Bank of Santa Fe already filed for final judgment of foreclosure. My money says the courts send me back for your eviction in less than 90 days.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: I removed the cables and - and I apologize. I shouldn’t have done that. That was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: It’s ok, we -

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: I can assure you, stealing is not ok. Mr. Nash will personally be speaking with your neighbors. And if we receive a report or drive by and see you stealing my water and power again, the next visit will be the Sheriff's department.  38. INT. RICK’S RANGE ROVER / FRANK GREENE’S HOME - CONTINUOU They sit down in Rick's SUV.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Don’t be soft. They’11l tell you sob stories each time. But the law is the law, that’s the side you’re on. You already know the outcome of this situation. So toughen up. They drive away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis follows Rick and looks around the massive home.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: I’‘1l take all your Rocky Mountain door handles - MR. HESTER (50s) and Dennis follow him into the dining ro

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: - the Tiffany light fixtures Moder Crystal chandelier - - into the kitchen -

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: - the Harlan cabinets, the Thai Jade and marble counter tops, the range the Subzero fridge. Three grand and you gotta be out of here in two weeks.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HESTER
dialogues.text: Make it five.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Four and Dennis here will get right to it.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HESTER
dialogues.text: Done. Dennis starts unscrewing the cabinets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis pushes a dolly loaded with cabinets and walks with Rick to the next home.  39.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: You know, Mr. Hester made a lot of money on this property.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: You’re evicting him in two weeks. How’s that?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: He got this place back in ‘05 for $400,000, 0% down. One year later, he took a home equity loan and got another $200,000 that he used to buy that sweet little Yellowfin for fishing trips and to take Mrs. Hester to Tahiti. By the time this home was worth half what he’d borrowed, he just quit paying.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: You can’t just quit paying.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Sure you can. He hired himself a lawyer - not to win - but to tie up his case for three years. Guess how Many mortgage payments he made during those three years?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: None. But he owes money.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Lawyer got a short sale approved, and the bank wiped out his debt. It's called, “strategic default.” While Mr. Greene is stealing my water and power, this guy was making a killing. Are you listening now? Do I have your attention?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, I heard you.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: That’s how you should’ve done it.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Now get everything else and meet me over there.  40. Points at the house next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick uses an iPhone attachment to open an electronic lock box. A key falls out. Unlocks door. Dennis watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's steps echo in the empty home. Dennis follows him i

dialogues.speaker: THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: - where the cabinets, fridge and counter-tops are all gon

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Install everything - patch the tile, caulk the cabinets and connect the gas line when you bring in the appliances.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: All that in here now?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: I’m selling this home for Fannie Mae. I can’t do that if there’s no kitchen, can I?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: So who just paid me $33,000 to buy new cabinets, appliances and a counter-top plus labor?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Fannie Mae.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Fannie Mae. Congratulations. You just fucked the government. He hands Dennis an envelope. Dennis takes it, but Rick ho on tight, refusing to let go.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: If you're interested, let me know. If not, use that to take your kid to Disney World and get yourself a job Migueling Cinderella’s Castle.  41. He lets go of the envelope and exits to the backyard. Dennis opens the envelope. He’s startled by what he sees: check for $3,250.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick answers emails on his phone. Notices Dennis approach

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I don’t give a damn about the government. They never did nothing for me, so... But that was a lot of money you just gave me. Feels a bit like trouble.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: You did honest work building homes your whole life. What did it get you but me knocking on your door?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Is this stealing?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: In 2006, you borrowed $85,000 against your home and never paid it back, Nash. You’re telling me that’s not stealing?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: No, it’s not stealing. I was given a loan. That’s me working my ass off trying to pay back that loan -

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: That’s not how the banks see it. Or the tax-payers paying for this bailout. Rick picks up overturned chairs by the pool. Dennis follo

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I invested every cent into construction equipment. The economy crashed, I can’t predict that. I can’t predict the weather.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Well I can. I’m a fucking Doppler radar. You’ve been stealing, but don’t want to admit it. Or the banks cheated you, take your pick. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Either way you’ve lost. But I made even more money in the crash than before it. You can too. But you need to stop lying to yourself and ask: What have you been doing wrong that your family lives in a motel? Dennis considers, then picks up the last overturned chair

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I‘1l do it. But I want you to help me get my home back. - And this is my first payment. He hands Rick the envelope, but Rick refuses.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Don’t get emotional about real estate.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: That's my family home, my boy's school. I want it back.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Not enough money here. Put that under your mattress because putting it in the bank only makes them money. When you have more, I’‘1l tell you what to do with it. - Now, do you want to double what you made?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis pulls up. JAVIER (30s) jumps in talking shit, hand Dennis a beer, who drinks and drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis and Javier take out an HVAC.

dialogues.speaker: JAVIER
dialogues.text: So who’s this Rick Carver dude?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: My boss, for the time being. They slide the HVAC in the truck next to two others.

dialogues.speaker: JAVIER
dialogues.text: What’re you doing?  43.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I gotta prove to the bank this shit’s missing so they pay us to put it back.

dialogues.speaker: JAVIER
dialogues.text: We're stealing it... to then bring it back.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: You wanna get paid? Then I gotta take a picture. Let’s do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis knocks. MR. TANNER emerges.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Mr. Tanner? My name is Dennis Nash, I’m here representing Rick Carver Realty. I understand your house has been foreclosed on?

dialogues.speaker: MR. TANNER
dialogues.text: The house still belongs to us. We intend to keep it that way.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I hope that works out. If it doesn’t, I want to tell you about cash for keys - He hands Mr. Tanner a form.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TANNER
dialogues.text: What do you mean, cash for keys?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Cash for keys is this -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis hands the cash for keys form to an AFRICAN AMERICA COUPLE.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: - if you leave your home in broom- swept condition prior to the eviction date the bank will give you $3500 which can help pay for a U-Haul, security deposit on an apartment, and -

dialogues.speaker: AFRICAN AMERICAN MOM
dialogues.text: Thank you, but no thank you. I’11l give this to my attorney and he’1l contact you. Good day. Closes the door in Dennis’ face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis tapes an eviction notice and takes a photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis and Javier carry an HVAC when Dennis notices the p pump. Javier lights up.

dialogues.speaker: JAVIER
dialogues.text: Whatcha doing?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Who’s gonna buy a home with a pool if the pool doesn’t work? Dennis removes the pump. A neighbor's light turns on.

dialogues.speaker: HVAC NEIGHBOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! What’s going on there?!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: You know Rick Carver Realty, you see that sign out front? That’s us. You have a good day.

dialogues.speaker: JAVIER
dialogues.text: Hell yeah, now that’s what I calla woman ! The men laugh as they steal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis explains CFK to a Vietnamese woman.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: It’s not a lot, but it’s going to pay for a U-Haul, a down-payment on an apartment...  45.

dialogues.speaker: VIETNAMESE WOMAN
dialogues.text: I have no idea what’s going on, because my mom and dad from Vietnam are coming and the house can’t be foreclosed on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis KNOCKS. Looks in the window. Tapes an eviction not to the door and takes a photo with a small digital camera EXT. MRS. TIDWELL’S HOME - DAY Dennis stand before a distraught MS. TIDWELL (30s, Africa American) at her door. She looks at a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I want you to know about “cash for keys.” This is a KYO form, it means “Knowing your options”.

dialogues.speaker: MS. TIDWELL
dialogues.text: Knowing my options? Her TEENAGE DAUGHTER starts filming Dennis with her phone MS. TIDWELL’S DAUGHTER I’m putting this all on Facebook, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: MS. TIDWELL
dialogues.text: Kayla, put that away! MS. TIDWELL’S DAUGHTER Mom he’s lying.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TIDWELL
dialogues.text: Kayla! - I’m sorry. I... I know you’re doing your job; I’m sorry. She quietly closes the door on Dennis who stands alone. H INT. DENNIS’ MOVING TRUCK - DAY Dennis and Javier load up the truck and drive away. EXT. ANGRY MAN’S HOME - AFTERNOON A ANGRY MAN peers out of his chained door. Dennis hesitan tries to hand him CFK paper work.  46.

dialogues.speaker: ANGRY MAN
dialogues.text: You the one that’s been putting notices on my windows?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: No sir, that’s the Sheriffs department.

dialogues.speaker: ANGRY MAN
dialogues.text: I don’t want them to do that anymore, that’s trespassing.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Sir I can’t control what the Sheriffs department does, what I can do is tell you about -

dialogues.speaker: ANGRY MAN
dialogues.text: You’re wasting your time. Just get outta here. Tell your bank and your boss I ain’t interested.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: If you wanna just take a look at -

dialogues.speaker: ANGRY MAN
dialogues.text: I’m not looking at anything.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: You could just take it and not look at it.

dialogues.speaker: ANGRY MAN
dialogues.text: Hold on a second. The Angry Man leaves. He comes back with a GUN.

dialogues.speaker: ANGRY MAN
dialogues.text: I think I’ve made myself very clear to you. I don’t want to see you again. Dennis backs away, thoroughly unnerved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis exits an EZ cash with the money he made today. He gets in his truck and drives away.  47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis pulls up in his truck, takes out a large paper bag Lynn is cutting the hair of motel friend DANA.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: What you got there? What do you have in there?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Steak.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: What? That’s Hamburger Helper. Dennis shows his mom steaks in the grocery bags.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: (shows her) What does that look like to you? Lynn is surprised - how could he afford this? But she’s a happy!

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: That looks like dinner! Let’s invite Dana too!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: More the merrier.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Hey - did you put that under your t- shirt?! They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: I’m not kidding! How else he got the money for that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis plays nerf basketball with Connor. It’s a fun mome that they really need. Lynn and Dana laugh and talk and drink beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis pushes up the garage door of the storage unit. Tur on lights to reveal HVACs and pool pumps. Rick counts the  48.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Eight. And four pool pumps. Good addition.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I figured “Why not?” Dropped this one - beyond repair - so better make it seven.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Sell it for scrap metal.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Already priced it out at $300.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Good. Invoice Rick Carver Realty $24K for the ACs and $3,200 for the pumps. The banks will reimburse me in that amount. Your take is 25%, about $6,700. Dennis is impressed.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I’m gonna need that Ruger.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Excuse me? What’d you say? Dennis looks annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: You’re saying you want the gun? Did I understand you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick opens the glove compartment and hands the gun to Den

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: I ran the background check already. You’re clear to carry it. Dennis holds the gun. It’s a little awkward in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Who pays the most out in cash-for- keys? - Fannie & Freddie. Then it’s BoA. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want you to go to every one of their foreclosed property in our books and find the ones that are unoccupied. No homeowner. And no tenant. You got that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis and Javier drive up and greet Dennis’ Crew and pul them and three other Guys they know into the truck. INT. DENNIS’ TRUCK [MOVING] - MORNING MUSIC. Dennis and Javier pass beers through the cab windo the 5 Guys in the back of the truck, laughing and joking. I/E. DENNIS’ TRUCK / VACANT HOME #1 - DAY From in the truck Dennis sees Javier peering into a vacan home (“Rick Carver Realty” sign). Javier runs to the truc

dialogues.speaker: JAVIER
dialogues.text: Empty as a mo-fo! I'd love to live in this bitch. 3221 Lincoln drive. Dennis writes the address on a lease agreement. I/E. DENNIS’ TRUCK / VACANT HOME #2 - DAY Dennis’ Crew #1 jumps into the back of the truck and shou DENNIS’ CREW #1 676 Capland Ave! Dennis fills out another lease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis fills out a lease and hands it to Crew #2, who sig He collects leases from the others who sign their names.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Ok. You are all now “tenants” of these properties with these lease agreements. DENNIS’ CREW Can we really move in?  50.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: No, dumb ass. You can’t really move in. We need the bank to think you live here so I can negotiate cash- for-keys deals with all of you.

dialogues.speaker: JAVIER
dialogues.text: How much they paying?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: «+--+ $2,500 checks from the government and the fucking banks. JAVIER & DENNIS’ CREW $2,500! Fuck ‘em up the ass! Yehaw! They’re happy as hell.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GOLF COURSE
dialogues.text: Dennis stands near golf carts at a distance from Rick, CO COMMISSIONER LINK (30s-50s) and two RICH MEN who talk on green. They shake hands; Rick and Link walk to Dennis.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTY COMMISSIONER LINK
dialogues.text: You think Freeman is the way to go?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: He’s Fannie’s number one attorney three years running and he can connect us to bulk buyers. I’m not talking millions of dollars; I’m talking billions. - Arthur, this is Dennis Nash. - County Commissioner Arthur Link. -Your property on 2102 West Jefferson; I’1l have Dennis make sure your gutters are re-done.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTY COMMISSIONER LINK
dialogues.text: What happened to Bill?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Killed him. This is my new guy and he’s gonna last.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTY COMMISSIONER LINK
dialogues.text: Alright, I-I'll get us a meeting with Freeman. (to Dennis) You want to move up in real estate, this is the guy. Link joins the men. Rick and Dennis drive away in a cart.  51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick drives. Dennis next to him.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: What do you have for me? Dennis shows the “fake” leases.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Successfully negotiated six cash- for-keys with six “tenants.”

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Not bad. So, Nash, how much did you tell your buddies - $3,500 per home or less?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Oh. You told them the full amount?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I told them what I told them. What do you care? Rick smiles like a devil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick parks the cart at the back of a massive, beautiful McMansion and walks to the swimming pool. Confused, Dennis follows Rick who greets TAMIKA, a gorgeo African American woman (early 20s) busy texting at the po

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: You look gorgeous, baby.

dialogues.speaker: TAMIKA
dialogues.text: I know. He kisses her for a while. Dennis watches, uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Don’t you have classes today?

dialogues.speaker: TAMIKA
dialogues.text: It’s all online. Can we go to Capital Grille tonight?  52.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Sure why not? He motions to Dennis who follows Rick. Rick shows him his business card.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: That's my sweetheart. She studies graphic design. I had her do my business cards. They enter -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis notices the mansion is empty except for a mattress the floor, a sofa, coffee table, and couple suitcases.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Is this yours?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Just keeping it warm. Scan the leases so we can email Fannie and BoA. Dennis moves to the scanner.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: So, Nash - why aren’t you married?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Uh. Don’t really have time for it.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: I don’t trust a man who isn’t married. Nobody does. - You want to tell me what happened to Connor's mom?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Prom night fiaso?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Close, yeah, something like that. Rick studies him for a moment. He produces a check from the paperwork on his desk.  53.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Your check from the ACs and pool pumps. Came out higher than I thought - $7,200. Dennis opens the envelope and sees the check... then hand back to Rick.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Keep it. I’1l give you the $3,000 I already made, and add my share from these leases. I want my home back.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: BPO on your home came in at $170K. I’‘ll buy it and you’1ll owe me. $155,000 at 12% amortized over 30 years with a two year balloon.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Jesus, that’s a shitty rate.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: No bank’11 loan you money and if you don’t pay, I’m on the hook. And I don’t want that property; it doesn’t have a future.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: It's my family home.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: It’s a home. But if you want it, it’s yours. It’ll take the bank eight to twelve weeks to list it on the MLS; you can do repairs, but you can’t move in until then.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: And the contract?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: I’‘1l have my office provide you the contract for deed.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: So it’s mine again?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Yes, it’s yours.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Ok. Thank you. Seriously thank you.  54. He extends his hand. Rick awkwardly shakes it. Dennis is emotional.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: No tears.... drink?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: No. I’m good. Rick pours a drink from the bar.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: You might want to reconsider. We have one more stop today. 224 Lakeview Court.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: That's Mr. Tanner. I offered hima Wells Fargo cash-for-keys.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: He never called and his eviction is today. You can pop your cherry with him. The first one’s a bitch. You get numb to it. Stand next to me today, but after this you’1ll do ‘em on your own.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Listen, Rick. Can't I -

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Go fuck yourself? Yes. What’d you think working for me would mean?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I just thought -

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: No, you didn’t think about it. And you didn’t have the guts to ask me. Nobody does. But who in their right mind wouldn’t rather put someone in a home than drag them out of it. Up until three years ago I used to be a regular real-estate broker, putting people into homes and speculating on properties. That was my job. - In 2006, Robert and Julia Tanner borrowed 30 grand to put an enclosed patio on their home which they had managed to live without for 25 years. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ask them when they’re spitting in your face as you walk them to the curb. Ask the banks why they gave them an adjustable rate mortgage. Ask the government why they lifted all regulations and turned a blind eye. You, the Tanners, the banks, Washington and every other homeowner and investor from here to China turned my life into evictions. I’m not an aristocrat. I wasn’t born into it. My dad was a roofer. I grew up on construction sites watching him work his ass off until he fell from a townhouse. A lifetime of insurance payments and they dropped him before he could buy a wheelchair but only after they got him hooked on pain killers. Do you think I’m going to let that happen to me? Do you think America 2010 gives one damn about Carver or Nash? America doesn’t bail out the losers. America was built by bailing out the winners. By rigging a nation of the winners, by the winners, for the winners. Do you go to church Nash? Do you?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Only 1 in 100 is gonna get on the Ark and every other poor soul’s going to drown. I’m not going to drown. They lock eyes for a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I’‘1ll do it alone. I’ve seen you do it. I know how it’s done. I’11 do it alone. I/E. DENNIS’ TRUCK / TANNER HOME - DAY From through the windshield of Dennis’ truck: Jeff, Crew and Locksmith loiter in the Tanners’ lawn; NEIGHBORS gather; the Sheriffs get out of their cruisers.  56. Dennis sees this from inside his truck. It’s hot and swea The windows are rolled up. He doesn’t want to be here.

dialogues.speaker: CLACK CLACK CLACK
dialogues.text: Sheriff #1 bangs his nightstick; Dennis unrolls his windo

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: (laughing) Hoooooly shit! Rick told me, but - Let’s go, rookie! Don’t think I got dressed up just for you. He laughs and walks off. Dennis opens the glove compartme and pulls out the gun. He holsters it on his ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis sweats as he walks to Mr. Tanner and MRS. TANNER standing at their front door with the two Sheriffs.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mr. Tanner. Ma’am. I’m Dennis Nash, from Rick Carver Realty.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TANNER
dialogues.text: I remember you, Mr. Nash. Why, why’re you here?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Um, I’m sorry to say, this home has been foreclosed on and transferred to the bank. I hate to be here doing this, but I'll need you to please step out of the property now.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TANNER
dialogues.text: No, I, I... my wife’s on the phone right now with our lawyer. You see, this is a mix-up and we’re going to have it all sorted out.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I understand, Mr. Tanner, but -

dialogues.speaker: MR. TANNER
dialogues.text: Honey! Honey, do you have him on the line?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Sir, it’s not going to matter -  57. Dennis sees Mrs. Tanner and two kids come to the door.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TANNER
dialogues.text: He wasn’t there. They said he’1l call us back.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TANNER
dialogues.text: There you go. We have to wait. We're filing an appeal, there’s no point in you being here right now.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I understand Mr. Tanner. But what I have here is a court order signed by the judge. What I can do is give you a few minutes to gather your personal items. Your checkbook, jewelry, medicines... your kids’... important belongings, but then I’m going to have to ask you to vacate the home.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TANNER
dialogues.text: Well, I don’t care. You were not supposed to be here today, so you need to leave now.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Ma’am. What I can do is -

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TANNER
dialogues.text: You are leaving. We are going back inside.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Please calm down ma‘am.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TANNER
dialogues.text: I am calm. I am calm.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Don’t close the door ma’am. Sheriff #1 moves Dennis aside. Sheriff #2 steps up.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TANNER
dialogues.text: You’re trespassing. You all need to leave.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: No, you and your wife are trespassing. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Any more trouble and we will walk you straight to the curb or the county jail. You decide. Dennis sees the Tanners go inside with the Sheriffs. Dennis sees Jeff smirking at him. Dennis sees the Sheriffs escort the Tanners out, clutchin bags, kids crying.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Clear. Get your men in here, Nash. Dennis motions to his crew who come marching up the lawn in the house.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: They can’t stand there. Dennis takes a deep breath and approaches the Tanners.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Mr. Tanner, ma’am, please walk with me to the curb.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TANNER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Let’s just go to the curb, please. He guides them to the street.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TANNER
dialogues.text: You’re responsible for this. You know that right? What happens to me, to my family. That’s on you. They reach the curb.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I’m sorry Mrs. Tanner. I didn’t want to do this today, I tried to avoid this -

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TANNER
dialogues.text: How do you live with yourself? Do you have a family? How could you? Shame on you. Shame on you. Jeff and crew start piling stuff up in front of them. Mr. Tanner begins to weep.  59.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TANNER
dialogues.text: It's ok, baby, it’s ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis stands alone in the Tanner’s living room watching clean out crew taking the Tanner’s belongs out. He looks out the window and sees them on the curb, crying

dialogues.speaker: I/E. GAS STATION
dialogues.text: Dennis enters the gas station and heads to the -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes the door. He is a wreck. He changes back to his work clothes. He stares at himself in the mirror. INT. DENNIS’ PICK-UP TRUCK [MOVING] - MORNING Dennis drives Lynn and Connor. They’re all happy.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Where’re we going?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I don’t know. You tell me.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: To see the Magic practice?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: All you can eat ice-cream at Denny's?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: No, but we can get that later.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Oh, oh, oh! I know. To see the Queen of England?  60.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: (laughs) No! - What?!

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: It's possible. I/E. DENNIS’ TRUCK / DENNIS’ HOME - MORNING They arrive at their home. Lynn and Connor can’t believe

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: What’re we doing here?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I don’t know. What’re we doing here? Grab these brushes. They get paint cans and brushes from the back of the truc

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Are we breaking in?

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Ask your dad. Dennis uses an iPhone extension to signal the lock box to open. The key pops out. Lynn gasps.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: There’s an app for that? INT. DENNIS’ HOME - CONTINUOUS They enter. Lynn and Connor are amazed, looking around.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: What are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: What are we doing here? They walk in. Lynn sees her garden has withered; weeds.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Oh my god, look.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: What are we doing here??

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I got the home back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What??

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Does that mean I get my room back?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Yup. Connor runs to his room.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: How’d you get the house back?

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: My room looks so big!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: That's becuase it is. (to Lynn) We won't be able to move in for a couple weeks, but... It’s ours again. I’ll explain. He goes to Connor’s room, leaving Lynn to digest everythi

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Oh my god. Lynn picks up and hangs her withered plant. INT. CONNOR’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS Dennis joins Connor.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: How about a bunk bed? What else?

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: A basketball hoop so I can dunk, right there!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: What else?

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: A hot tub! A hot tub right there, you can break the wall down! And the wall should be silver like the Orlando magic.  62.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: You know what else I was thinking? I was thinking in the backyard we could get a pool.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: A pool?! Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: You have to help me paint the house first. Let’s start painting. He hands Connor tape and rubs his ear, who accepts. INT. DENNIS’ HOME / KITCHEN & LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Lynn cleans dusts of the kitchen counters. She’s tearing Dennis enters and watches her.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: How are you doing this? How is this real?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
