dialogues.text: My boss bought it for me and I’m paying him back in installments just like a bank. Dennis shows her the contract.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: (suspicious) What does he get?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: He gets his money back. He gives me work so he’s keeping me working. (about Connor) He’s painting his room right now. I got it back. Lynn stares at the contract. She has doubts. Looks at him

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Derek arrives.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Derek! What’s up!  63.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: What’s up Derek?

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Hi Mr. Nash! They play play-wrestle and have fun, Dennis pretending to a gorilla.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: The dominant Silverback Gorilla! We've been spotted! Lynn watches them play, still unsure. EXT. ANGRY MAN’S HOME - DAY BZZZZZZ. CU - Locksmith drills the lock off and opens the door. Sheriff enters with his gun drawn.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Sheriff's Department. Anybody home?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Alright, jump in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis (Sheriff, crew, locksmith) evicts a TENANT MAN.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: So you are not Mr. Ron Curtis?

dialogues.speaker: TENANT MAN
dialogues.text: No. He’s my landlord. He lives in Miami.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: You're not the owner of this property?

dialogues.speaker: TENANT MAN
dialogues.text: No, we rent, we've been paying the rent here for 8 years.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Sir, I put notices on your door -  64.

dialogues.speaker: TENANT MAN
dialogues.text: And I gave them to the landlord. He told me to ignore them, that he was doing a loan re-modification and not to worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Your landlord has scammed you. You’ve been scammed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis hands the check to an OLDER AFRICAN AMERICAN WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: OLDER AFRICAN AMERICAN WOMAN
dialogues.text: That’s $3500, right?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, $3500. She struggles to remove the home key from their chain.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER AFRICAN AMERICAN WOMAN
dialogues.text: I can't... She hands it to Dennis who removes it. He hands the chain back. I/E. DENNIS’ TRUCK - DAY Dennis puts the keys into a container of other keys. I/E. MR. BALDWIN’S HOME - DAY Dennis and Sheriff #3 stand at the door with MR. BALDWIN, (70s-80s, confused, floral shirt).

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Hello Mr. Baldwin, my name is Dennis Nash, I’m here representing Rick Carver Realty. Today is the day of your eviction, I’m afraid.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BALDWIN
dialogues.text: No no, I have a reverse mortgage on this house and my wife and I took it out. My wife went down to the bank and she signed the papers.  65.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Mr. Baldwin, there was a process in place, all the paperwork was submitted, signed by a Judge, it’s all legal. Mr. Baldwin, step outside for me please... Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BALDWIN
dialogues.text: Ok... Mr. Baldwin steps out. Sheriff 2 stays with Baldwin as De and Sheriff #1 enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis speaks with a MIDDLE AGED WOMAN as clean-out crew bring out her belongings.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE AGED WOMAN
dialogues.text: We already did the modification, they approved it, we sent in our first check...

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: What I suggest is we figure out a way to get all your stuff safe - a U-Haul or something like that.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE AGED WOMAN
dialogues.text: I’m going to have to call my husband. I could maybe store it at my sister’s house down the street for a day or... She stops, overwhelmed. EXT. DENNIS’ TRUCK - DAY Dennis puts another sets of keys in the jar - it’s half f now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis tries to communicate with a HISPANIC MOTHER as her HISPANIC SON translates. The young son struggles to explain the situation as Denni speaks and the mother listens.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: The house isn’t your anymore.  66. The son translates. The mother takes it in.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. EVICTION HOME
dialogues.text: Dennis looks in the window, KNOCKS one last time, then no to the Locksmith, who saws out the doorknob. Dennis enter with the Sheriffs and sees the house is fully furnished: Parakeets CHIRP in a cage; family photos and a crucifix o the wall; laundry hanging to dry in the backyard.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Anyone know what to do with a bird?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Tidwell signs a CFK. He hands her a check.
Mrs. Tidwell stares at the check. She hands over her keys. INT. DENNIS’ TRUCK - CONTINUOUS Dennis puts another key in his jar - now it is full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis confronts a group of SURLY HOMEOWNERS.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I’m trying to give you the better option here, I’m going to have to send these guys, who are being employed today to go in and grab your stuff and throw it on the curb.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: I really don’t want to take you to jail. I don’t have the time -

dialogues.speaker: SURLY HOMEOWNER
dialogues.text: Well you know what you can do with that? (points to the clipboard) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SURLY HOMEOWNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can do something else with that because I’m not gonna touch it. EXT. MR. BALDWIN’S HOME - DAY Mr. Baldwin sits in a plastic chair, a box on his lap.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Do you have any family or friends?

dialogues.speaker: MR. BALDWIN
dialogues.text: I have a son up in Michigan, but I haven’t seen him in a couple years...

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Do you have his phone number?

dialogues.speaker: MR. BALDWIN
dialogues.text: No, no...

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Nobody you can stay with?

dialogues.speaker: MR. BALDWIN
dialogues.text: No, no I don’t...

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Any neighbors that can help you out?

dialogues.speaker: MR. BALDWIN
dialogues.text: I don’t know my neighbors anymore.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: I can give you a ride to the Salvation Army or the Red Cross? Dennis stares at the lost and helpless Mr. Baldwin. HOLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis can’t sleep. Connor is tangled up with him. He rem Connor’s arm and quietly gets out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smokes a joint and stares at traffic on an overpass.  68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a suit and slicked hair, Dennis looks like a new man.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Please lower your chin and turn your head towards me... That’s it. Rick stands next to the PHOTOGRAPHER.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Say “short-sale” three times and smile. Dennis smiles and the camera flashes repeatedly.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Rick approves of the business card and hands it to Dennis

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Pretty civilized. Dennis looks at a card with his photo: DENNIS NASH, SENIO SALES MANAGER, Rick CARVER REALTY, INC. INT. WILLIAM FREEMAN’S OFFICE - MOMENTS LATER WILLIAM FREEMAN (50s, confident) sits behind his desk in glass office. Freeman’s ASSOCIATE, Dennis, Rick and Link around the table. Dennis listens carefully as they talk:

dialogues.speaker: COUNTY COMMISSIONER LINK
dialogues.text: Tesken Equity Management just picked up 400 homes in the last two months, all-cash buys - no loans. A hundred million dollars. Orange County needs your help to find another bulk buyer like Tesken. As they talk Dennis notices Freeman's Lawyer who beat him court.

dialogues.speaker: MR. FREEMAN
dialogues.text: And I'd like to know where the new highway that’s to connect 414 and the Apopka Expressway is going to be.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTY COMMISSIONER LINK
dialogues.text: Yes, well, that information isn’t public yet, so...  69.

dialogues.speaker: MR. FREEMAN
dialogues.text: I have a lot of property that could be impacted by the zoning board's decision. Rick smiles with pride; Dennis notices.

dialogues.speaker: MR. FREEMAN
dialogues.text: Anything else, Arthur?

dialogues.speaker: COUNTY COMMISSIONER LINK
dialogues.text: Ok. Yes, yes. I know the route.

dialogues.speaker: MR. FREEMAN
dialogues.text: There’s a bulk buyer here out of New York, Vesic Investment Group. But they’re shopping with a pissant broker out of Kissimmee named Ortiz who just sold them 15 homes last month.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir. I know Ortiz. I can get Vesic Investment Group away from him and my team can handle as many homes as you have to sell.

dialogues.speaker: MR. FREEMAN
dialogues.text: I have upwards of 1000 homes. Possibly more. Get me Vesic and we'll be in business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis and Rick walk.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: 1000 homes. Do you know how much money we're talking about? Track Ortiz, find who he’s talking to and what properties they’re looking at. We need to know what the Vesic deal is.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Rick. What’s my cut?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up and get going.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: You can’t handle 1000 homes without me. Standard commission is 6%. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s my cut to help you get Vesic to Freeman? Rick smiles, then laughs.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: I’‘1l give you 5% of my take.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: 6 and a hand job. No calluses. You’11 pull in something between $200 to $300K.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: That’s more than you made in your -

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Yeah yeah, more than I made in my whole life. They shake. Partners. I/E. DENNIS’ TRUCK / RITZ CARLTON HOTEL - MORNING ORTIZ (40s-50s) waits at the lobby. Dennis notices PRADEEP KHANNA (30s-40s, Indian-American, confident, NYC look) exit the hotel and greet an affable Ortiz. They get in Ortiz’s SUV. Dennis follows them. I/E. DENNIS’ TRUCK / ORTIZ HOME #1 - MORNING Dennis pulls up to a home as Ortiz parks. Dennis sees Ortiz and Khanna look around the home. Ortiz shows Khanna information on an iPad as they enter the hom Dennis takes a photo of the home, including a sign in the lawn: FOR SALE BY BANK OF SANTA FE.  71. I/E. DENNIS’ TRUCK / ORTIZ HOME #2 - DAY Dennis watches Ortiz and Khanna examine another foreclose home. A FEMALE HOMEOWNER peers out her door. BEEP. Text message from Rick: last 4 homes all bank of santa fe I/E. DENNIS’ TRUCK / FRANK GREENE’S HOME - AFTERNOON Dennis sees Ortiz and Khanna drive away. He looks towards home and sees Frank and his family. He gets out of his tr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Frank's Wife put recycled cans into car trunk. sees his Sons riding bikes. Dennis approaches Frank; Frank stops him.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Hey, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: What do you want? You with those guys?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: No, not at all. Just come to see how you’re doing. If you want, maybe I can get you a job.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: Nice suit. Still working for your friend?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I didn't have to come here. I just wanted to -

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: To lie to me? To cheat me?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: To help you. Have you thought about where your kids are gonna live when you lose this? It’s not pretty.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: My kids have a home. This one right here. I did research and took boxes of files to a lawyer. Pro-bono. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m going to win my home legally, in court.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Be realistic. The judges don’t care, and the courts -

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: “Be realistic?” I didn’t ask for your help, sir. And I don’t want it. You’re trespassing. Please get off my property and don’t come here again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick drinks whiskey as Dennis thinks.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: There's over 100 homes in this deal. Ortiz, the king of the Miguels, is going to sell 100 homes to Vesic. (points at maps on wall) They're all in these neighborhoods, priced between $165 and $200K. We're talking upwards of a $20 million deal. And it’s not mine.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Tamika enters with an iPad and wraps her arms around Rick

dialogues.speaker: TAMIKA
dialogues.text: Triple word score. Take that.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: We’re working.

dialogues.speaker: TAMIKA
dialogues.text: I know. Dennis, tell him to take a break.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Rick. Take a break. Suddenly, Rick wraps his arms around her and gives her a deep, passionate kiss. Dennis studies maps on the wall. Then -  73.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Vesic already bought 15 homes from Ortiz last month.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I’m going to take out all the ACs, water pumps, and appliances from those homes. And who do you think Vesic will blame?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Ortiz. They’1l call immigration and put him on his lawn mower back over the border while I’m on the phone with the Bank of Santa Fe.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: And we’ll sell a 100 homes.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: And 1000 more for Freeman. I see green skies ahead.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Start by putting green in my pocket. I’1l empty out the 15 homes tonight. $100 a pop. $1,500.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis uses his iPhone to open the electronic lock box. Javier and Dennis’ Crew (two) approach with dollies.

dialogues.speaker: JAVIER
dialogues.text: HVACs and water pumps?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Get the appliances this time too - dishwasher, fridge, oven. Skip microwaves. Dennis uses his iPhone to get the key.

dialogues.speaker: JAVIER
dialogues.text: You’re going in?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: You’re going in.  74.

dialogues.speaker: JAVIER
dialogues.text: Nah, that’s B&E man, that’s guaranteed time right there.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: It’s not B&E if you got a key - we're doing appliances, fridges...

dialogues.speaker: JAVIER
dialogues.text: Aiight. I/E. DENNIS’ TRUCK / DENNIS’ NEW HOME - SUNSET Dennis drives and talks on phone.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yeah. Rick said he wanted me to handle the short sale for him, so I’m heading there now. - Hang on. He notices something and stops in front of an impressive with a “foreclosure Rick Carver Realty” sign in the yard.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Do you know if 1484 Lakewood Drive is for sale?... I just drove by the place... Yeah? Does it have a pool?... Let me call you back. He opens the door and looks at: a beautiful, large, stucc home with palm trees. Paradise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s Connor’s birthday. Dennis grills, Lynn cuts cake, Co is happy. Derek, the neighborhood kids, Justin and the mo kids are all there.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Lynn holds the pinata and Dennis and Connor smash it together, father and son are happy together.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Lynn wonders where Dennis is. Dennis returns with a brand bike for Connor. Connor jumps all over it.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Whoa! Connor hugs his dad and runs off with Derek and friends.  75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis and Lynn watch Derek and Connor ride bikes. Justin motel kids ride old bikes and scooters. Families around.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Show us what you got! Connor rides circles around Dennis as Lynn looks on, happ Then... an EVICTED FAMILY (husband, wife, two kids) drive up. Confused and exhausted, they unpack their station wag

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: (about the family) Hey Connor, let’s see if these guys want some of your cake. We got some cheese pizza left - you wanna ask if they want some cheese pizza? Dennis stares at the family; something’s wrong. He turns starts to leave abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Alright, I gotta get Derek home.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Okay, we’re just gonna grab some pizza and some cake, I think it’d be nice to say hi to these guys.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Fine, I just gotta get Derek home. The EVICTED MAN sees Dennis.

dialogues.speaker: EVICTED MAN
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey! Where you going? Hey you! Over here. I’m talking to you! Dennis reluctantly turns. The Evicted Man is visibly angr

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: You’re talking to me?

dialogues.speaker: EVICTED MAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m talking to you. What're you doing here? Are you following me?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: No, I live here. I don’t know what you’re talking about so...  76.

dialogues.speaker: EVICTED MAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know who you are. What’re you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EVICTED MAN
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: What do you mean? I live here, I just told you I live here. I don’t know you, ok?

dialogues.speaker: EVICTED MAN
dialogues.text: No, you're Rick Carver Realty, I know exactly who you are. Dennis starts trying to move the Man away from his family

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Listen, listen - you don’t know me. I don’t know you.

dialogues.speaker: EVICTED MAN
dialogues.text: I know you! You kicked me out of my home!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: What? Lynn’s face darkens. Connor looks on, confused.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I don’t know you!

dialogues.speaker: EVICTED MAN
dialogues.text: You work with Rick Carver, you kicked me out of my home!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Come over here, we’ll talk.

dialogues.speaker: EVICTED MAN
dialogues.text: Why would I wanna go over there? I wanna talk right here. Nash, that’s your name, isn’t it? Connor stares.  77.

dialogues.speaker: EVICTED MAN
dialogues.text: You don’t want everyone else here to know what a fucking asshole you are? And how you kicked me and my family out of our home?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: You got me mixed up with somebody.

dialogues.speaker: EVICTED MAN
dialogues.text: No I don’t. I know exactly who you are. Everyone at the motel is watching now. Evicted families, kids, neighbors.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Just calm down.

dialogues.speaker: EVICTED MAN
dialogues.text: You kicked me out of my home! You ruined my fucking life! Dennis tries to leave. Evicted Man shoves him back.

dialogues.speaker: EVICTED MAN
dialogues.text: No, you don’t get to go anywhere!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: (getting angry) Don’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Dennis!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Get inside!

dialogues.speaker: EVICTED MAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, get inside!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: (shoves him) Don’t fucking talk to her!

dialogues.speaker: EVICTED MAN
dialogues.text: What’re you gonna fucking do?! He shoves Dennis and they are in a fight. Lynn, Connor, D and the entire motel watches.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Stop, please!  78. Connor watches Dennis and Evicted Man fighting. Motel peo try to break it up.

dialogues.speaker: EVICTED MAN
dialogues.text: You motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: (to Lynn, Connor) Go inside! Go inside!

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Dennis!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Take Connor inside!

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Okay! Lynn takes Connor, still staring, away. Motel people fina get the Evicted Man away from Dennis.

dialogues.speaker: EVICTED MAN
dialogues.text: You ruined my life!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I’m not messing with this guy, he’s crazy. I don’t know you.

dialogues.speaker: EVICTED MAN
dialogues.text: You know me!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I don’t fucking know you!

dialogues.speaker: EVICTED MAN
dialogues.text: I know you, Rick Carver Realty! I know you! I’‘ll see you every day. When you wake up. When you go to bed. When your fucking kid is playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connor’s new bike in the cramped room; Lynn and Connor si silently. Dennis stares out the window.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: How'd he know your name?  79.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Because he knew your face too.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I don’t know, I work on foreclosed homes, maybe he saw me at his house or -

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Rick Carver, Dennis? Is that who you’re working for?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: No. No, I don’t work for him.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: You’re kicking people out of their homes? Like the people who live here?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: No! I don’t -

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: That man just said -

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: He's lying, ok. I’m not kicking anyone out of their home! That guy was crazy. You saw him. That asshole Carver, he just represents his home by chance. That’s it. She doesn’t buy it. Someone BANGS on the window startling them all.

dialogues.speaker: ASSHOLE
dialogues.text: Dennis pulls the curtains shut; the room gets dark. Silen

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: We can’t stay here. Connor can’t stay here.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: We’re not going to. I’m not doing anything wrong, so stop giving me all this shit.  80.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Are you evicting people?

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: He said you were at his eviction!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I don’t know that fucking guy! I don’t know how he knows me, I work on foreclosed homes, mom! This guy got foreclosed on, maybe he saw me at his home, I don’t know! He opens the door to leave.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Lock the door. And keep the curtains closed. He slams the door shut leaving Lynn and Connor alone.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: AERIAL VIEW OF: Walt Disney World, Sea World, The Magic Kingdom castle... then neighborhoods, homes and more home

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick points out landmarks to Khanna. It’s stuffy and swea They shout to hear one another. Dennis stares out the window, amazed at the amount of hom the size, the scope. His imagination runs wild. HOLD.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Disney World, Sea World, Universal Studios. Downtown Orlando’s 10 miles at your 2 o’clock, and at your 4 o’clock you’1ll see the Bank of Santa Fe homes.

dialogues.speaker: KHANNA
dialogues.text: I never realized how close they were to shine-ola.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: About the Bank of Santa Fe deal -  81.

dialogues.speaker: KHANNA
dialogues.text: - it hasn’t even been a week since we picked up 15 homes from Ortiz and all the appliances, ACs and water pumps are missing.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: You’re kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: KHANNA
dialogues.text: That’s $150,000 hit. Hidden expenses kill returns, so Vesic’s not interested anymore.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: This Bank of Santa Fe deal is like one giant ATM machine. What can I do to get Vesic back into those homes?

dialogues.speaker: KHANNA
dialogues.text: I just don’t think it’s possible.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: How about this: I’1l put appliances back in those 15 homes - free of charge - and you move The Bank of Santa Fe from Ortiz over to me. Khanna smiles. Rick is uncertain why...

dialogues.speaker: KHANNA
dialogues.text: Tell you what. Put brand spanking new appliances, ACs and water pumps into any of the 100 homes that need them and you got yourself a deal.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Appliances, yes. ACs and water pumps, no. Rick is surprised Dennis spoke.

dialogues.speaker: KHANNA
dialogues.text: Ok. But the homes have to be unoccupied in 30 days. Put it in writing and you have a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty-Mansion-Party. Dennis, Rick, Tamika, KARINA (20s), LINK, sexy young WOMEN and DISTINGUISHED TYPES mingle. MU  82.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Rick and Dennis talk above the crowd near a chandelier.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: For the Santa Fe deal I’1l give you 6% of my share. You'll end up with around $63,000 pre-tax.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: (grins) I guess I can accept that, - 63,000, you said? Shit yes! Tamika and Karina arrive with drinks.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: You used to dream about one home. Now it’s 100.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: (raises glass) To dreams.

dialogues.speaker: TAMIKA
dialogues.text: To dreams.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Fuck dreams. To 100 homes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone dances. Karina grinds Dennis. Rick and Tamika mo romantic. Drunk, Dennis rubs his face - he’s losing control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick dangles his feet in the water, smoking a cigar. Denn comes down the walkway.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. The Zombie is coming to get me. Dennis slumps on the dock beside him, drunk. Thinks.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Has anyone ever come up to you, somewhere, after an eviction?  83.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Someone tried to run me off the road a year ago. I haven’t gone to dinner once with my wife and girls in the last three years without looking over my shoulder. It’s why I carry this, even now, 5am. He takes his gun out and shows it.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Is it worth it?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: .--. As opposed to what?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Did someone get to you?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Someone's calling you. Or they found you? Dennis says nothing. Rick sets his gun down between them.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: So. Nash. The sun is coming up and here we are. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: You wanted to kill me once. Now you’re going to make a lot of money.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I did wanna kill you. I dunno. I dunno what I’m doing here, but I’m thankful. What can I do, you know, my dad... Well he killed himself pretty much. (holds up his drink, then pours it out) Sorry to waste your booze. He died of a heart attack, booze, food, whatever you wanna call it. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Left me with my mom, my boy... My boy... As opposed to what?... Rick stares on.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I need to move into my home. Now. I can’t wait anymore.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: It's gotta be listed for sale on the MLS first. Few more weeks.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: No. I can’t stay in that motel any longer.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Just pick another one. You got the money now, buy whatever you want. There's plenty of homes in the sea. Like I said, don’t get emotional about real estate, Nash! They’re boxes. You listening? Big boxes, small boxes. What matters is how Many you got. You’re gonna have more properties than women to fill ‘em with. You know that, right? Buy one for your mom, one of your kid and one for yourself. What do I care? Yes sir, 100 homes...

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: 1000 fucking homes. Rick lies down and smokes his cigar.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Watch out for the gators. They don’t sleep. Make sure I don’t roll into the water. Dennis thinks about the future... something on his mind. INT. DENNIS’ TRUCK [MOVING] - DAY Dennis drives the family in the packed truck, just like w they were first evicted.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Why are we going this way?  85.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I want to show you something. Lynn stares out the window, uneasy. EXT. DENNIS’ NEW HOME - AFTERNOON The large beautiful home that Dennis saw earlier. He pull up; they get out. Lynn and Connor are confused.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Just trust me and follow me please. INT. DENNIS’ NEW HOME - CONTINUOUS Dennis opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Have a look.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Come on! Just a quick tour. They are startled by the size and high-ceilings. He shows them around, a large master bedroom and two othe rooms - all furnished.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: It’s a cool pool.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I'd say. You wanna dive in, right?

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Who’s basketball hoop is that?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I think that used to belong to Shaquille O'Neal. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he lowered it because he likes to dunk sitting down.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Can we go now? Please?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: You see the pool? Lynn shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I bought this for you. Connor and Lynn don’t get it. Dennis points to the pool.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: (to Connor) And you. That’s your pool.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Let’s go home, this isn’t funny.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I’m not joking, mom.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: That's not his basketball net. This is somebody else’s. And I want our house. I wanna go home.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I sold that home. I sold it and flipped the money into this. This is ours, fresh start. I don’t want to go back to the house we were evicted from.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: (shocked) You sold our house?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: There is no more home. We couldn’t move in there for three weeks, and we had to move, didn’t we? So I got this. I had to get us out of that motel so Connor wouldn’t get killed, so I wouldn’t get killed -

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Who gave you this home? How did you get it? By kicking people out of their homes? You buy this?! 86.  87.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I didn't kick anybody out of this home, I bought this home with money that I earned! So I could put a roof over your head and I could put food in his mouth! We were drowning, mom, we had to get out!

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: It stops here.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I bought this fair and square. I didn’t take it from anyone.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: I’m gonna call Jimmy. We’re moving to Tampa. Come on Connor. She walks to the door with Connor.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Wait. Mom.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: And you're gonna figure this out.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I did this for Connor. We were drowning.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Rick Carver? Rick Carver who bought our house for us? I’m not staying here. I’m not staying in this home. Dennis looks at Connor.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: What do you want? Connor goes to his mom. Dennis is devastated. I/E. DENNIS’ HOME - NIGHT Dennis turns on the swimming pool light while drinking a beer. He’s drunk. Turns on all the lights in the backyard Lynn prepares Connor a simple dinner. She glances at Denn turning on lights throughout the house. Connor looks up at his father through the windows.  88. INT. DENNIS’ NEW HOME - MORNING He walks through his empty home. He goes to Lynn’s locked bedroom door and knocks.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Connor?... Mom, is Connor okay?

dialogues.speaker: LYNN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He’s sleeping. EXT. DENNIS’ NEW HOME - MORNING Dennis paces around the pool smoking. His phone RINGS. He looks at the home as he talks.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hi Rick... Right now? -... ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis enters and sees: Freeman's office in the distance. Behind the glass window are Rick, Freeman, Link, and Freeman’s Associate. Dennis sees a YOUNG LAWYER run from one end of the office with a paper in his hand. He enters Freeman's office and hands the paper to Freeman, who looks it over and nods. Freeman hands the paper to Rick, who walks out of the off and bee-lines to Dennis.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: One of the Santa Fe homeowners is blocking his eviction in court tomorrow. If he’s successful and others will follow and Vesic will pull out. He hands the paper to Dennis.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: This is a proof of publication; it wasn’t filed six months ago. Freeman's boys just back dated and notarized it. You need to be at the courthouse globe at 9:45 a.m. The Court Clerk will meet you there. Give it to him.  89.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: This is forged?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: It's a stupid piece of paper someone forgot to file when the loan was being bought and sold a million times over. It’s just a technicality. Dennis looks at the paper and turns white as he reads:

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: ... Frank Greene.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Yeah, the same deadbeat who was stealing my water and power. I told you he was no good. He CLAPS loudly and startles a distracted Dennis.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: HEY! That’s not your dick in your hand. That’s the Santa Fe deal, 100 homes, 1000 more with Freeman, our money, Miami, your home, everything. You awake or what?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yes. Ok.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Don’t “yeah, yes, ok” me. Courthouse globe. 9:45 am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The envelope in hand, a hesitant Dennis looks at the glob On the other side of the room, he spots Frank Greene spea with his attorney. He’s careful not to be seen. Dennis sees Frank hug his WIFE and kids. They’re optimist They're going to win. He stares at Frank’s Son, a lot like Connor.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK'S SON
dialogues.text: (to the lawyer) Hello. He shakes hands with the lawyer.  90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis rubs his face with water. BEEP BEEP. He reads texts from Rick: where the fuck are you? / call Dennis looks at his RINGING phone. It’s Rick calling. Den declines the call. The time on his phone reads: 9:52am. He dries his face and looks at himself in the mirror. RINGING. RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hel -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick tries not to shout -

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: What the hell’s going on?!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Nothing, I -

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Get your ass to the globe now, or consider your life over. How far are you?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: I’m here now.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: I’m about to give it to him.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Dumb fuck! Call me as soon as it’s over. Hangs up. Dennis stands in the bathroom, envelope in hand  91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Court Clerk (from Dennis’ eviction) paces near the gl Dennis sees him. Instead of approaching, he turns and lea

dialogues.speaker: COURT CLERK
dialogues.text: Hey!... Hey! Dennis sees the Clerk taking quick strides to him.

dialogues.speaker: COURT CLERK
dialogues.text: Are you with Rick Carver? Dennis hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: COURT CLERK
dialogues.text: Are you with Rick Carver? Are you with Carver or not? Dennis doesn’t respond.

dialogues.speaker: COURT CLERK
dialogues.text: Is that it? The Clerk grabs it from him.

dialogues.speaker: COURT CLERK
dialogues.text: Idiot! He quickly leaves. Dennis stands alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis peers though the window of the double doors and se Frank Greene next to his Attorney adjacent to Freeman Law

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: As far as I can tell, the proof of publication is here. The Bailiff hands the paper to Frank’s Lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: FREEMAN LAWYER
dialogues.text: Your Honor, we already have a buyer in place and we'd like to get this property off the books.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK'S LAWYER
dialogues.text: If we check the file index, I’m sure this has not been docketed.  92.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: That may be, but the proof is in the file and that’s all the statute requires. I’m ordering the sale to go forward.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: Wait a second... what? Your Honor, this isn’t right. We know for a fact that file was not there.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: BSB versus Ballard.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: I was there. I know there was no proof of publication. (to his lawyer) You, you know it wasn’t there. (to Judge) My... my wife and kids are here. Do you see them? My wife, my children? INT. DENNIS’ NEW HOME - DAY Dennis enters. He looks around. At the pool. Nobody is there. He goes upstairs. Getting more concerned.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Connor? Moves to the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Mom? Connor? Connor?! Nobody is there. Dennis dials his phone. RINGING. RINGING. Voicemail. He breaks down. Lynn and Connor are gone. INT. DENNIS’ NEW HOME - NIGHT Dennis drunkenly plays with Connor's basketball, his phon next to the gun. He drinks from the whiskey bottle.  93. INT. DENNIS’ NEW HOME - SUNRISE Sunlight hits Dennis, passed out and alone in the large, empty living room. RING. RING. He wakes up from a nightmare. Grabs his phone It's not his family.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hi Rick -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT BETWEEN Rick AND DENNIS Rick pulls up to Dennis’ home in his news BMW X6 SUV.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Morning Donald Trump. I’m outside your new mansion. Where are you? Frank Greene’s eviction. Let’s go. It hits Dennis like a punch in the gut.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hello? Dumb ass. You there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick drives. Dennis sits.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: There’s eight other homeowners that we're going to have to evict after Greene. We need to make aggressive cash-for-keys offers to them. We’1l pay out of pocket if we have to. But if they give me any flack - Freeman’s boys and the court clerk, baby. No big deal. Dennis looks out the passenger window, tormented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boiling-hot day. Sheriffs, Jeff and crew wait outside Greene’s home. NEIGHBORS across the street. Rick and Dennis arrive. They approach Sheriff #1 who’s speaking with FRANK’S NEIGHBOR.  94. While they talk, Dennis stares at Frank’s home and sees F peering at them from behind his living room window curtai

dialogues.speaker: FRANK'S NEIGHBOR
dialogues.text: --. She’s a worried wreck saying Frank hasn’t slept in days. That he’s up all night on the internet -

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Excuse me, ma’am. - Bobby. Let’s get this show on the road.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Morning Rick. Possible trouble with the tenant - Mr. Greene. Seems he and his wife -

dialogues.speaker: FRANK'S NEIGHBOR
dialogues.text: Even last night we heard him yelling -

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Ma’‘am. Thank you. We’re not marriage counselors. (to Sheriff) Let’s get cooking.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Small problem; he may be armed. Dennis takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Well go find out, Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: I’11 call back up and check it out. Dennis squints his eyes in the bright sun and looks at Fr behind the curtain.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Is his family in there with him?

dialogues.speaker: NEIGHBOR FRIEND
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. She was at my door this morning crying before he called her back inside. The kids didn’t go to school either. They all stare at the house.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Alright, I’m going to check it out.  95.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Thanks for the play by play. Hurry up. Sweat falls over Dennis’ eyes. He wipes it as he watches two Sheriffs walk towards Frank’s house. Then Dennis sees Frank raising something towards them. Dennis realizes what’s about to happen. It’s fast. And lo

dialogues.speaker: SMASH, SMASH
dialogues.text: Frank Greene smashes the window and raises a Remington Woodmaster 742 semi-automatic 30.06 rifle out of his home Neighbors and Crew run for cover, SCREAMING. Frightened, Rick pulls Dennis behind his SUV.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: I don’t want to hurt anyone. Please get back. All of you. You’re trespassing. I don’t want to hurt anyone, but this is my home. Get off my property.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: (to Dennis) Where’s your gun?! You don’t have it?!

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Sir, put the weapon down!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: You’re trespassing! Frank fires TWO SHOTS at the grass. Sheriffs run behind their cruisers and pull their guns.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Shots fired, shots fired! Dennis punches the side of Rick’s SUV.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Fuck, fuck!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: I am not going to leave here! Dennis hears Frank’s Wife and kids crying for him to stop  96. I/E. FRANK GREENE’S HOME - CONTINUOUS Frank motions his wife and kids to get back.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: Go to the bedroom. Don’t stand there! Get in the bedroom, now! Sheriff #1 points his gun at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Sir, put the gun down! Frank points the weapon out the window again.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: God damn it, stop it! Put that down, put it down, now!

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Not gonna happen, sir! Frank hides out of view again.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Sir, why don’t you send your wife and kids out? Dennis sees Frank staring out at what he’s done. Police car arrives. Two POLICEMEN jump out with guns, ask for update.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Sir, drop your weapon! Silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: The courts decided my fate in 60 seconds flat. Nobody checked the file index. Fact. No proof of publication filed. Fact. Nobody looked at my cancelled checks that prove payment to the bank. Fact. The judge was retired, not up for re-election and not beholden to the citizens of this county. A lifetime in 60 seconds and this is my home.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK'S SON
dialogues.text: Dad!  97. Frank turns to him and the gun goes off accidentally shoo a box of files. They SCREAM. Frank is horrified.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: Get in the bedroom! Dennis hears this.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Fuck! No, no! He looks at Rick, inches from him. They’ve never been thi close. Rick breaths hard, sweats; he’s scared. Rick notices a shift in Dennis and squints his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: --- No. Dennis rips his arm free, gets up from behind the SUV and walks to the lawn. Rick tries to stop him, but is frightened.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Dennis!

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Get back! Do not approach the house!

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Do something! What the hell are you waiting for?! Dennis ignores Rick and the Sheriffs’ PLEAS and walks tow Frank’s home.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: Stop! Get off my property. Please get back or I’m going to shoot. I will shoot you. Frank points the rifle and Dennis stops walking.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: I’m not going to leave my home. Get off my lawn.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: This is your home, this is your property Frank, I know! Please put that down.  98.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: The banks made more money last year than anytime in the history of human civilization. Fact. Fact. Sounds of sirens. Dennis glances behind and sees police cars, fire trucks a ambulances arrive. DETECTIVES and COPS in bullet proof vests spill out.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: I have the right to shoot anyone who steps foot on my property. You are trespassing. Get off or I will shoot. I don’t want to do this.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Frank please put it down and let your family out, please!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: Look up there. Look. Look up there. Do you see that? Look! Dennis looks up. The sun glares in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: That is the sun and it is shining. You can’t tell me it’s night when I know it’s day. Even if God came down here and said it was night, I know it’s day. I know what I know, and nobody can tell me the sun isn’t shining. Nobody. Dennis and Frank’s eyes are locked. And Dennis’ mouth ope

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I cheated you. I put a forged document in your file the morning of your case. Frank takes this in. He is not surprised. Detectives, sheriffs, cops, neighbors all hear Dennis’ wo Rick stares with wonder and fear at Dennis.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: This is your home. Frank and Dennis stare at each other.  99. Rick and everyone waits with wonder. Frank lowers his rifle. Then tosses it out the window.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GREENE
dialogues.text: I’m coming out. He opens the door and steps out of the home with his hand high.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE
dialogues.text: Get on your knees. Now. Hands behind your head. Lie down. Dennis watches Frank get on his knees, then lie down. Police advance, guns pointed, knee to his back, handcuff Dennis sees Police escort Frank's frightened family out o the home to safety. Two Detectives approach Dennis and talk with him. He points at Rick. Rick watches the Detectives escort Dennis towards him. Rick smiles and taps Dennis on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: You did a hell of a thing, son. A hell of a thing.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir. Are you the bank’s realtor?... Sir? Dennis and Rick stare at each other. HOLD.

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: (to Dennis) Thank you. Dennis stares at Rick’s steely eyes. Did he mean it?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Sir? Are you Rick Carver?

dialogues.speaker: RICK CARVER
dialogues.text: Yes, I am.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: We need to speak with you.  100. Dennis and Rick look at each other for one last moment be the Police take Dennis away. Rick puts on his sunglasses. I/E. DETECTIVE’S CAR / FRANK GREENE’S HOME - CONTINUOUS The Detective seats Dennis in the car and is called away. Dennis is alone. He looks out the back window and sees Rick trying to grab Sheriff #2 by the shoulder to talk, but the Sheriff brush him off and Alone, Rick Dennis sees phone. They Dennis then Frank’s son future. quickly walks away. gets on his phone, calling someone, pacing. the Detectives approaches Rick who gets off the begin questioning him. sees Franks’s son outside the car. looks at him, smiles, and runs away to a better
